intro: Plectronia subopaca, commonly known as the dark-leaved plectronia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
